metadata.title: CVE-2014-7203 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
libzmq (aka ZeroMQ/C++) 4.0.x before 4.0.5 does not ensure that nonces areunique, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to conduct replay attacksvia unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzmq3 - 4.0.5+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zeromq3 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.5+dfsg-2').
